meanings.definition: Affected with an ulcer or ulcers.
meanings.sent1: The ulcerated wound on his leg was painful.
meanings.sent2: Her ulcerated skin required special treatment.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ulcerated paw made it walk funny.
meanings.sent4: The city's ulcerated infrastructure needed urgent repair.
meanings.sent5: The ulcerated sore was a constant source of discomfort.

meanings.definition: To become affected with an ulcer or ulcers.
meanings.sent1: If left untreated, the wound may ulcerate.
meanings.sent2: The infection caused the skin to ulcerate quickly.
meanings.sent3: The neglected garden began to ulcerate with weeds.
meanings.sent4: The conflict threatened to ulcerate the relationship between the two countries.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room seemed to ulcerate with each passing minute.
